assertion: Fertilisation can only occur if the ovum and sperms reach the ampullary region simultaneously.
reason: This is because not all copulations lead to fertilisation and pregnancy.

assertion: The zona pellucida layer of the ovum allows entry of multiple sperms during fertilisation.
reason: Changes in the ovum membrane after first sperm contact block additional sperm entry.

assertion: Secretions of the acrosome help the sperm enter the cytoplasm of the ovum.
reason: They help the sperm penetrate the zona pellucida and plasma membrane.

assertion: During copulation, semen is released into the uterus.
reason: Semen is released into the vagina during copulation.
